name: How to [ACTION] in [CITY], California
description: Complete guide to [ACTION] in [CITY]. Learn the step-by-step process, costs, timeline, and how to work with licensed Professional Engineers for your [PROJECT_TYPE] project.

step.name: Initial Consultation
step.text: Contact a licensed Professional Engineer for a free consultation. Discuss your project scope, timeline, and budget. In [CITY], consultations typically cover [CITY_SPECIFIC_REQUIREMENTS].

step.name: Site Evaluation
step.text: The engineer visits your [CITY] property to assess existing conditions, take measurements, and identify any site-specific challenges such as soil conditions, setbacks, and structural requirements.

step.name: Engineering Design & Analysis
step.text: The PE performs structural calculations, analyzes loads (seismic, wind, dead, live), and designs the structural system in compliance with the California Building Code and [CITY] local amendments.

step.name: Plan Preparation
step.text: Detailed structural plans are prepared including foundation plans, framing plans, connection details, and structural notes. Plans are formatted for [CITY] building department requirements.

step.name: PE Stamp & Certification
step.text: The licensed Professional Engineer stamps and signs all plans and calculations, certifying the design meets California Building Code requirements. This is required for permit approval in [CITY].

step.name: Permit Submission
step.text: Submit PE-stamped plans to the [CITY] Building Department for plan check review. Processing time in [CITY] typically takes [PERMIT_TIMELINE].

step.name: Plan Check Corrections (if needed)
step.text: Address any plan check comments from [CITY] building department. Your PE will revise plans as needed and resubmit. Most projects require 0-2 revision cycles.

step.name: Permit Approval & Construction
step.text: Once approved, you receive your building permit from [CITY]. Construction can begin following the approved structural plans. PE may provide construction observation if required.
